metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8905 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Xen through 4.6.x on 64-bit platforms mishandles a failsafe callback, whichmight allow PV guest OS users to execute arbitrary code on the host OS, akaXSA-215.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-system-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-utils-4.6 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-utils-common - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xenstore-utils - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xen package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1').
